intro: Adenia glauca, commonly known as the blue adenia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows to a height of 2–5 meters. The plant features smooth, greyish bark and produces clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a waxy texture. Adenia glauca is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
